Flemington.bias_notes: Tier 1 (HQ). Straight Six (1200m) is wind dependent. 1400m/1600m very fair. 2500m is the 'Graveyard of Champions'. Wide track allows swoopers. Barrier Impact: Low (3/10).

Wagga.bias_notes: Wagga (MTC): Triangular track layout. 420m straight. 1200m start is tricky for inside gates. 1400m chute allows leaders to control. Generally fair but favors horses that can corner well.

Bunbury.bias_notes: Bunbury (New Track): Velvetene turf on sand profile. Drains very fast (Good 4 likely). 20m width gives room, but the 'Fremantle Doctor' wind often helps leaders in the back straight.

Randwick.bias_notes: Tier 1 (HQ). Features 'The Rise' in straight testing stamina. Heavy tracks shift bias to extreme outside rail. 1600m start disadvantages outside barriers. Barrier Impact: Moderate (6/10).

Moonee Valley.bias_notes: Tier 1. Tightest metro track. 173m straight. CRITICAL LEADER BIAS. Barriers 1-3 are gold; Wide barriers are a graveyard. Races won from 600m mark. Barrier Impact: Critical (9/10).

Kilcoy.bias_notes: Kilcoy: 'The Go-Kart Track'. Tiny 1276m circumference with a miniscule 143m straight. Critical Leader Bias. You must lead or box seat. Swooping from back is geometrically impossible. Surface is Kikuyu (Hard/Fast in summer).

Caulfield.bias_notes: Tier 1. Sharp turns, triangular shape. On-Pace bias. 1400m 'dog-leg' start favors inside significantly. Momentum runners (3-wide with cover) can swoop late. Barrier Impact: High (7/10).

Rosehill.bias_notes: Tier 1. Premier 'On-Pace' track. Hard to make ground from back despite 408m straight. Specialists thrive here. Golden Slipper 1200m favors middle gates (4-8).

Eagle Farm.bias_notes: Tier 1. 'Randwick of the North'. Spacious and fair. Drains rapidly. Bias favors runners getting off the fence (3-4 lanes) in straight. Form transfer from Doomben is strong.

Doomben.bias_notes: Tier 1. Tight, saucer-shaped. Leader/On-Pace critical. 1350m start makes wide draw a killer. Barrier Impact: Critical (8/10).

Ascot.bias_notes: Tier 1 (WA). 294m uphill straight tests stamina. 'Fremantle Doctor' tailwind aids leaders in summer. Leaders who kick on the bend are hard to run down.

Sandown.bias_notes: Tier 1. Hillside: Galloper's track, uphill finish, favors stayers. Lakeside: Tighter, prone to on-pace bias if rail is out.

Canterbury.bias_notes: Tier 1. EXTREME LEADER BIAS. 'Jump and Run' tactics essential. Banked turns slingshot leaders. Barrier Impact: Extreme (9.5/10).

Warwick Farm.bias_notes: Tier 1. Triangular shape. Leader biased. Sharp home turn punishes horses hung wide. Local trained horses (Baker) often have advantage.

Belmont.bias_notes: Tier 1 (Winter). Handles wet well. Fairer than Ascot; flat straight allows swoopers.

Morphettville.bias_notes: Tier 1 (SA). Course Proper: Very fair, wide turns. The Parks: Tighter, favors on-pace. Adelaide class often lags Melbourne by 2-3 lengths.

Gold Coast.bias_notes: Tier 2. Tight, turning track. Polytrack is consistent/on-pace. Turf favors inside draws (8/10 impact).

Sunshine Coast.bias_notes: Tier 2. Big sweeping bends. One of the few QLD tracks where you can win from last.

Newcastle.bias_notes: Tier 2. Huge, spacious. 415m uphill straight. Fair. Form translates to Randwick.

Gosford.bias_notes: Tier 2. Tight, rectangular. Leaders track. Short straight. Barrier Impact: High (8/10).

Kembla Grange.bias_notes: Tier 2. Sister track to Randwick (identical dimensions). Long straight suits big horses. Watch for cross-wind bias.

Geelong.bias_notes: Tier 2. Premier provincial. Key Spring Carnival lead-up. Very fair drainage.

Mornington.bias_notes: Tier 2. Distinctive 'dip' and uphill run before turn. Very short straight (210m). Specialists thrive. Leader bias common.

Toowoomba.bias_notes: Tier 2. High altitude. The 'Clifford Park Climb' uphill finish is severe. Specialists dominate.

Fannie Bay.bias_notes: Tier 2 (Darwin). UNIQUE. Severe kickback. Leaders/On-Pace only. If not in first 4 at turn, you lose. Must handle heat/dirt.

Fair Grounds.bias_notes: Fair Grounds (NOLA): DIRT - Extremely long stretch (1,346 ft). Closers have a fair chance compared to other speed-favoring tracks. Watch for 'Dead Rail' days. TURF - Wide course, favors late kicks.

Gulfstream Park.bias_notes: THE SPEED TRACK. 6F sprints are Wire-to-Wire dominated. Golden Rail is common. One-turn mile plays like a sprint. Turf turns are extremely tight.

Saratoga.bias_notes: Graveyard of Champions. Deep, tiring track. Rail often dead. Favors Stalkers/Closers.

Del Mar.bias_notes: Short stretch. Speed/Pressers favored on dirt. Turf is narrow and firm.

Santa Anita.bias_notes: Speed favoring dirt, but turns to Closer/Stalker bias on wet/sealed tracks (Dead Rail inversion). Hillside Turf favors Closers.

Ascot.bias_notes: Stiff uphill finish. Stamina is key. High numbers often drawn wide on straight course.

Newmarket.bias_notes: Rowley Mile has a 'Dip' before finish. Experience helps.

Tokyo.bias_notes: Massive sweeping turns and long uphill straight. Closers paradise.

Nakayama.bias_notes: Tight turns, short straight with steep hill. Positional speed is critical.
